text.name: sys_description
text.text: MSX is a standard of microcomputers released in Japan. It dates from the 1980s, a time where computers produced by various manufacturers were often compatible with each other thanks to MSX-DOS 1. MSX stands for Machines with Software eXchangeability, but it is often interpreted as MicroSoft eXtension. The MSX displayed graphics in 256 × 192 pixels with 16 colors and saw the first generation of games converted from the arcade. It included gems such as Penguin Adventure, Exa Inova, Crusader, α-roid, and Gall Force.
